workflow.description: Creates a resource pool with the default CPU and memory allocation values. To create a resource pool in a cluster, the cluster must have VMware DRS enabled.

bind.name: resourcePool
bind.description: The parent of the new Resource Pool

bind.name: name
bind.description: Name of the new Resource Pool

bind.name: cpuAllocationExpandableReservation
bind.description: If true, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value. Null for default value

bind.name: cpuAllocationLimit
bind.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. Null to disable this limit

bind.name: cpuAllocationReservation
bind.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the resource pool. Null for no reservation

bind.name: cpuAllocationSharesLevel
bind.description: The allocation level. Null for default value

bind.name: cpuAllocationSharesShares
bind.description: The number of shares allocated. This value is only set if level is set to custom. Null for default value

bind.name: memoryAllocationExpandableReservation
bind.description: If true, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value. Null for default value

bind.name: memoryAllocationLimit
bind.description: The utilization of a resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. Null to disable this limit

bind.name: memoryAllocationReservation
bind.description: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the resource pool. Null for no reservation

bind.name: memoryAllocationSharesLevel
bind.description: The allocation level. Null for default value

bind.name: memoryAllocationSharesShares
bind.description: The number of shares allocated. This value is only set if level is set to custom. Null for default value

bind.name: newResourcePool
bind.description: If no errors, contains the newly created resource pool
